result.execSummary:
The defendant Chauncey Earl Dear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs through 25% of prison wages.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT, with credit for 137 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chauncey Earl Dear

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Chauncey Earl Dear in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Chauncey Earl Dear in custody.  Ron Dauge for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF4081 that are attached to the complaint.   Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Sean Mahnke. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chauncey Earl Dear in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Chauncey Earl Dear in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
